poem:
**The Morning Headline**

In the unfolding silence of dawn,  
words scatter like leaves—  
combat, ceasefire, famine—  
the world a tangled web  
of contradictions.  
A pen's ink spills over Gaza:  
tear-streaked paper warms  
by the breakfast table.  
The air thickens around us,  
each breath a silent plea  
for peace amidst the ruins.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "IDF declares famine-hit Gaza City a combat zone, ending ‘tactical pauses’ that allowed limited food delivery – Middle East crisis live 10.51am BST A spokesperson for the Israeli military said earlier this week that the evacuation of Gaza City is “inevitable”. Benjamin Netanyahu has said Israel will launch its Gaza City assault while simultaneously pursuing a ceasefire, though talks have stalled. The Israeli prime minister has claimed the assault is the best way to weaken". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: IDF declares famine-hit Gaza City a combat zone, ending ‘tactical pauses’ that allowed limited food delivery – Middle East crisis live 10.51am BST A spokesperson for the Israeli military said earlier this week that the evacuation of Gaza City is “inevitable”. Benjamin Netanyahu has said Israel will launch its Gaza City assault while simultaneously pursuing a ceasefire, though talks have stalled. The Israeli prime minister has claimed the assault is the best way to weaken
